Origins: On 29 January 2013, the Daily Currant published an article about conservative commentator Ann Coulter's refusing to stay on board a commercial airline flight because the aircraft was piloted by a black woman:
Description: By the following day links and excerpts referencing this article were being circulated via social media, with many of those who encountered it mistaking it for a genuine news article. However, that article was just a bit of political humor which satirized the viewpoints expressed in Coulter's books and newspaper columns. As noted in the Daily Currant 's " About " page, that web site deals strictly in satire: The Daily Currant is an English language online satirical newspaper that covers global politics, business, technology, entertainment, science, health and media. Q. Are your newstories real? A. No. Our stories are purely fictional. However they are meant to address real-world issues through satire and often refer and link to real events happening in the world
Example: [Collected via e-mail, January 2013] A recent item re Ann Coulter refusing to board an airplane because the pilot was black has gone viral on Facebook and Twitter.
Claim: Ann Coulter refused to stay aboard an airplane piloted by a black woman.
